Hi robert

Glad to receive a mail from u .I understand some concept from u .But let
me have
some more confusions in what u are trying to say to me .

Robert Watkins wrote:

After that, the optimising virtual machine (HotSpot) would be doing its
stuff. Essentially, Java code gets faster, the more times it is run
within a
given JVM (to a point of diminishing returns).

Bala > Could u explain me some more details regarding optimising virtual
machine and
 "to a point of diminishing returns " .Every time , it will create the
object
  in heap memory

Robert Watkins wrote:

In addition, you may notice some large jumps in the time taken. This is
because the JVM has either been kicked off the CPU by the operating
system, or garbage collection has occurred.

Bala > Why the Jvm should be kicked off the cpu by os or garbage
.neither
 i didn't force the gc to happen nor the system is idle .As i said
earlier ,every time
object is created and it is collected by gc

Hoping that u can understand and give me a solution

Regards
Bala





--------------B8A5D5AA592137A9E8DB5C5A
